alert.note: Alert for Bennett (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 1:53PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bennett County through 230 PM MDT... At 152 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 3 miles southeast of Allen, or 7 miles northwest of Martin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martin, LaCreek North Housing and Sunrise Housing. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
